setting.name: project_path
setting.comment: Project path for locating app resources

setting.name: server:connect
setting.comment: If false, won't connect udp sender / listener for server or client

setting.name: server:ip
setting.comment: The multicast group udp address and port of the server

setting.name: server:send_port
setting.comment: The send port of the server. Match these between server and client

setting.name: server:listen_port
setting.comment: The listen port of the server (which is what the client sends on). Match these between server and client.

setting.name: platform:architecture
setting.comment: If this is a server (world engine), a client (render engine) or both (world + render). clientserver is an EngineClientServer, which both displays content and can control other instances. standalone does not transmit or receive.

setting.name: platform:guid
setting.comment: Unique identifier for network traffic (appended by additional unique values).

setting.name: xml_importer:cache
setting.comment: If the xml importer should cache xml content or reload from disk each time

setting.name: xml_importer:target
setting.comment: target for xml importer target properties to match

setting.name: span_all_displays
setting.comment: Automatically spans displays and overrides world size, src/dst rect and screen:mode

setting.name: world_dimensions
setting.comment: The size of the overall app space.

setting.name: src_rect
setting.comment: The rectangle of the world space to render.

setting.name: dst_rect
setting.comment: The output window size and position to render.

setting.name: screen:title
setting.comment: The title of the window. Generally only displays if the screen mode is windowed.

setting.name: screen:mode
setting.comment: How the primary window displays, including fullscreen

setting.name: screen:always_on_top
setting.comment: Makes the window an always-on-top sort of window.

setting.name: screen:auto_size
setting.comment: Classic uses the old src_rect/dst_rect and span_all_displays; letterbox will letterbox to your main monitor; all_span spans all displays; main_span fills the main display. letterbox requires having a world size set.

setting.name: console:show
setting.comment: Show console will create a console window, or not if this is false.

setting.name: idle_time
setting.comment: Seconds before idle happens. 300 = 5 minutes.

setting.name: system:never_sleep
setting.comment: Prevent the system from sleeping or powering off the screen

setting.name: apphost:exit_on_quit
setting.comment: Exit apphost when quitting the app

setting.name: resetup_server_on_display_change
setting.comment: Resetup the server when the display changes

setting.name: frame_rate
setting.comment: Attempt to run the app at this rate

setting.name: vertical_sync
setting.comment: Attempts to align frame rate with the refresh rate of the monitor. Note that this could be overriden by the graphic card

setting.name: auto_hide_mouse
setting.comment: True=automatically hide the mouse when mouse hasn't been moved, false=use hide_mouse setting

setting.name: hide_mouse
setting.comment: False=cursor visible, true=no visible cursor.

setting.name: camera:arrow_keys
setting.comment: How much to step the camera when using the arrow keys. Set to a value above 0.025 to enable arrow key usage.

setting.name: platform:mute
setting.comment: Mutes all video sound if true

setting.name: animation:duration
setting.comment: Standard duration for animations

setting.name: load_image:threads
setting.comment: Number of threads to spawn for image loading

setting.name: font_scale
setting.comment: text sprites with scale font values by this amount

setting.name: touch:mode
setting.comment: Set the current touch mode: Tuio, TuioAndMouse, System, SystemAndMouse, All.

setting.name: touch:tuio:port
setting.comment: UDP Port to listen to tuio stream.

setting.name: touch:tuio:receive_objects
setting.comment: Will allow tuio to receive object data.

setting.name: touch:override_translation
setting.comment: Override the built-in touch scale and offset parsing. It's uncommon you'll need to do this. Default is to use the built-in Cinder touch translation, which is generally correct if the window is the same pixel size as the main screen and not scaled at all.

setting.name: touch:dimensions
setting.comment: How large in screen pixels the touch input stream covers

setting.name: touch:offset
setting.comment: How much to offset touch input in pixels

setting.name: touch:filter_rect
setting.comment: Any touches started outside this rect will be ignored, in world space. Set to 0, 0, 0, 0 to ignore.

setting.name: touch:debug
setting.comment: Draw circles around touch points

setting.name: touch:debug_circle_radius
setting.comment: Visual settings for touch debug circles.

setting.name: touch:debug_circle_color
setting.comment: The color of the touch debug circles

setting.name: touch:debug_circle_filled
setting.comment: If the touch debug circles are a filled or stroked circle.

setting.name: touch:rotate_touches_default
setting.comment: Rotates touch points if the sprite getting touched is rotated. Helpful for table situations that can have sprites rotated 180 degrees or whatnot.

setting.name: touch:tap_threshold
setting.comment: How far a touch moves before it's not a tap, in pixels.

setting.name: touch:minimum_distance
setting.comment: How many pixels away from an existing touch point for a new touch to be considered valid.

setting.name: touch:smoothing
setting.comment: Average out touch points over time for smoother input, but slightly less accurate.

setting.name: touch:smooth_frames
setting.comment: How many frames to use when smoothing. Higher numbers are smoother. Lower than 3 is effectively off.

setting.name: touch:swipe:queue_size
setting.comment: How many frames of touch swipe info to account for when calculating swipes

setting.name: touch:swipe:minimum_velocity
setting.comment: The velocity a swipe needs to exceed to count as a swipe

setting.name: touch:swipe:maximum_time
setting.comment: How long a swipe can last to be counted as a swipe

setting.name: resource_location
setting.comment: Resource location and database for cms content

setting.name: resource_db
setting.comment: Path of the database relative to the resource_location. E.g. ../db/database.sqlite

setting.name: configuration_folder:allow_expand_override
setting.comment: Allows you to place any relative file in a configuration folder. For instance, you could have a layout file specific to a particular configuration.

setting.name: cms:url
setting.comment: The URL of a Content Management System, set as DS_BASE_URL to use that env variable.

setting.name: node:refresh_rate
setting.comment: If your app uses a NodeWatcher, how often to check for node updates

setting.name: content:node_watch
setting.comment: If ContentWrangler should automatically listen to dsnode messages on udp localhost port 7777

setting.name: content:model_location
setting.comment: Where ContentWrangler should look for an xml file that describes a data model to load sqlite data. Specify multiple locations separated by a semicolon

setting.name: content:use_wrangler
setting.comment: If ContentWrangler should be used to automatically grab data

setting.name: auto_refresh_app
setting.comment: Listen to directory changes and auto soft-restart the app.

setting.name: auto_refresh_directories
setting.comment: Semi-colon separated list of directories to listen to to restart the app.

setting.name: logger:level
setting.comment: What level of log to log.
setting.possibles: all, none, info, warning, error, fatal

setting.name: logger:module
setting.comment: all,none, or numbers (i.e. 0,1,2,3). Applications map the numbers to specific modules.

setting.name: logger:async
setting.comment: Whether to save logs on another thread or the main one.

setting.name: logger:file
setting.comment: Filename and location

setting.name: logger:verbose_level
setting.comment: How much verbose output to log. 0=nothing, 9=everything

setting.name: metrics:active
setting.comment: Enable telegraf metrics sending

setting.name: metrics:send_base_info
setting.comment: Send common engine info like fps and number of sprites

setting.name: metrics:base_info_send_delay
setting.comment: How often to send the base info in seconds

setting.name: metrics:send_touch_info
setting.comment: Record touch data or not

setting.name: metrics:udp_host
setting.comment: The host name to send udp metrics info to

setting.name: metrics:udp_port
setting.comment: The port to send udp metrics info to

setting.name: load_image:create_texture_on_main_thread
setting.comment: True will create the gl texture on the main thread. Only use if you have issues with delayed image loading, typically in fullscreen
